intro: Coryphadenia, commonly known as the flame tree, is a tropical plant native to parts of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is characterized by its striking, fiery orange to red flowers that bloom in clusters during the dry season. The plant has compound leaves with elongated, lance-shaped leaflets that are often covered in fine hairs. Coryphadenia thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in warmer climates. Its rapid growth and vibrant floral display make it a notable species in botanical gardens and landscapes.
